page.title: 03THE METRO COMES TO TYNEMOUTH
page.content:
Tynemouth has had a succession of railway stations over the last 100 years but the increasing numbers of private cars has led to a steady decline in traffic since the mid 1950's. Trains were becoming obsolete.
Tyne and Wear County Council devised a completely new policy for public transport which would enable the population to travel anywhere in the County by either bus or the new Metro.
The Metro is a rapid transit system operated by lightweight trams running for much of their distance along the old railway lines. The system is powered by electricity and is a fast and popular way to travel.
